text: Michael Francis O'Dwyer, KCIE, (April 1864 â€“ 13 March 1940) was a British colonial administrator. He was an Irish Roman Catholic. He was Lieutenant Governor of Punjab during the Amritsar Massacre committed by General Dyer and was controversial for his defense of Dyer. Category:Colonial officials of British India Category:Punjab Category:1864 births Category:1940 deaths
title: Michael O'Dwyer
